caption:
This photograph depicts a view through a grassy park towards a distant urban skyline. In the foreground, the grass is a vibrant green, and a person is partially visible, walking from right to left. The individual appears to be wearing a dark jacket and pants, with their back to the viewer.

Two large trees frame the image; one on the left with a split trunk and another on the right whose branches stretch across the top-right corner of the frame, both casting shadows and adding a dappled light effect on the ground. Between these trees, several buildings of different architectural styles and heights can be seen, signifying a cityscape. The buildings are varied in design, ranging from historic, with traditional features and ornate embellishments, to more modern, stark structures.

The sky is a clear blue, suggesting a bright, sunny day. The overall composition beautifully contrasts the natural, serene setting of the park with the bustling, constructed environment of the city in the background, offering a narrative of coexistence between urban development and green spaces.
title: Mulky Square is a neighborhood in the west side of Kansas City, an area of low-income dwellings. I-635 will cut right through Mulky Square, which is already isolated by railroad yards on the west, I-70 on the north, and I-35 plus a 4-lane freeway on the east looking east toward downtown. Area in foreground was cleared for I-635.
